newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks open higher on bargain hunting. [CORRECTED 02:10 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks open higher on bargain hunting. [CORRECTED 02:10 GMT]

text.p: Tokyo stocks gained ground in early morning trade on Tuesday as participants took to bargain hunting after a sharp decline on Monday, brokers said. Players with short-positions also bought back, they added.
As of 0016 GMT, the Nikkei 225 was up 200.12 points, or 1.06 percent, at 19,024.30. Its September futures were up 170 points at 18,950.

(Corrects month from March to September and figure from 180 to 170). "The stabilising dollar-yen rate and the rebound in New York stocks on Monday will support market sentiment in Tokyo," a broker said. On Monday, the Nikkei index lost 780.28 points, its biggest decline this year.
